title: hack3rcon
author: hack3rcon
content: Hello,I want to migrate from the Trust Wallet to another wallet and I have some questions:1- Which wallet offers similar features and security?2- I staked some Tron coins in my Trust Wallet, if I import my seed phrase to other wallets, then What happens to them? They staked automatically to the new wallet or I must unstake them before using a new wallet?3- Can I use two wallets simultaneously?Please answer my questions briefly and share your experiences.Thank you.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: 1. Exodus, Unstoppable.money. Neither of them support staking for tron though.2. They will remain staked, but you won't be able to see them.3. Yes, you can do that.If you choose to migrate to another wallet, all you would need to do is to import your recovery phrase to the new wallet.

comments.author: hack3rcon
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on May 19, 2023, 03:59:28 PM1. Exodus, Unstoppable.money. Neither of them support staking for tron though.2. They will remain staked, but you won't be able to see them.3. Yes, you can do that.If you choose to migrate to another wallet, all you would need to do is to import your recovery phrase to the new wallet.Hello,Thank you so much for your reply.The Exodus doesn't support Tron staking?So, I must unstake my coins first, then use another wallet?

comments.author: AbuBhakar
comments.body: Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PMHello,1- Which wallet offers similar features and security?Atomic wallet is your best choice if you want same feature and experience since it supports almost all coins with open source that is much better to trust wallet. It has a built-in staking feature so there’s no need to rely on 3rd party defi apps.Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PM2- I staked some Tron coins in my Trust Wallet, if I import my seed phrase to other wallets, then What happens to them? They staked automatically to the new wallet or I must unstake them before using a new wallet?It depends on the new wallet that you use if it’s support web3 feature. Remember that your coins ownership is on your private key. So regardless of what wallet are using to stake the coins, You can still access your stake coins on other wallet as long as you use same private key or seed phrase.Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PM3- Can I use two wallets simultaneously?Yes

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 04:03:22 PMHello,Thank you so much for your reply.The Exodus doesn't support Tron staking?So, I must unstake my coins first, then use another wallet?No, it doesn't look like the support tron staking: https://www.exodus.com/status/Well, if you're not interested in keeping them staked, then yes you can go ahead and unstake. If you do switch to another wallet, and keep your funds staked, then nothing will happen to them, you just won't be able to unstake them from this new wallet and you have to do it from Trustwallet instead.Quote from: AbuBhakar on May 19, 2023, 04:08:44 PMAtomic wallet is your best choice if you want same feature and experience since it supports almost all coins with open source that is much better to trust wallet. It has a built-in staking feature so there’s no need to rely on 3rd party defi apps.Is it actually open source? I found their github account, but not the wallet's code repository.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: I think only Metamask is capable to import the seed from Trustwallet but I do not think it's a safe way to import seed phrases from Trustwallet to Metamask.If I were you why not create a new wallet on Metamask and send all your funds from trustwallet that's the safest than using the same seed from another wallet.And if you staked some Tron coins on the trust wallet just leave it there or better use the ledger hardware wallet they do support staking on ledger live.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on May 19, 2023, 03:59:28 PM2. They will remain staked, but you won't be able to see them.I staked a coin on Atomic. I import the seed phrase on Trsutwallet, I saw the coin staked but I was not able to unstake the coin. I unstaked it on Atomic wallet. I staked on Trustwallet, I did not see it on Atomic wallet at all. I staked on Trustwallet, it gave me problem and I was unable to unstake it which has not happened to me before but once. I import the seed phrase on Keplr, I successfully unstake the coin on Keplr wallet easily.Quote from: AbuBhakar on May 19, 2023, 04:08:44 PMAtomic wallet is your best choice if you want same feature and experience since it supports almost all coins with open source that is much better to trust wallet. It has a built-in staking feature so there’s no need to rely on 3rd party defi apps.I do not like Atomic wallet because they are using their own validator. I prefer wallet that have several validators. If anyone want to stake coins like Atom, Osmosis, the best wallet is Keplr.For staking Tron, I have not gone into details about it before.

comments.author: Rigon
comments.body: Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PMHello,I want to migrate from the Trust Wallet to another wallet and I have some questions:1- Which wallet offers similar features and security?You can move from trust wallet to other wallet. But of course you need to import the seed phrase. But you can use Atomic Wallet and TokenPocket Wallet. You can use this wallet as multi wallet. Very good in terms of security.Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PM2- I staked some Tron coins in my Trust Wallet, if I import my seed phrase to other wallets, then What happens to them? They staked automatically to the new wallet or I must unstake them before using a new wallet?Since you have Tron staking in your trust wallet, if you use another wallet to import the same seed phrase, you must unstake your Tron from the trust.  Then you can see your Tron balance in your other account.Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PM3- Can I use two wallets simultaneously?Of course you can use  more than two wallets at the same time. But be sure to keep your wallet seed phrase in a safe place after importing it. Since you will be copying it, don't paste it on Twitter, Telegram, Messenger, etc. That should be noticed first.Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PMPlease answer my questions briefly and share your experiences.Thank you.I don't use multiple wallets. I am using trust wallet only. But I intend to use Electrum wallet very soon. Since I only hold bitcoins at the moment I decided to use Electrum wallet for more security and for my convenience.

comments.author: hack3rcon
comments.created_time: May 19, 2023, 06:25:42 PMLast edit: May 24, 2023, 03:10:43 PM by achow101
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on May 19, 2023, 04:14:24 PMQuote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 04:03:22 PMHello,Thank you so much for your reply.The Exodus doesn't support Tron staking?So, I must unstake my coins first, then use another wallet?No, it doesn't look like the support tron staking: https://www.exodus.com/status/Well, if you're not interested in keeping them staked, then yes you can go ahead and unstake. If you do switch to another wallet, and keep your funds staked, then nothing will happen to them, you just won't be able to unstake them from this new wallet and you have to do it from Trustwallet instead.Quote from: AbuBhakar on May 19, 2023, 04:08:44 PMAtomic wallet is your best choice if you want same feature and experience since it supports almost all coins with open source that is much better to trust wallet. It has a built-in staking feature so there’s no need to rely on 3rd party defi apps.Is it actually open source? I found their github account, but not the wallet's code repository.Hello,Thank you so much for your reply.So, I must unstake my Tron coins first, then send them to another wallet?Quote from: BitMaxz on May 19, 2023, 04:18:39 PMI think only Metamask is capable to import the seed from Trustwallet but I do not think it's a safe way to import seed phrases from Trustwallet to Metamask.If I were you why not create a new wallet on Metamask and send all your funds from trustwallet that's the safest than using the same seed from another wallet.And if you staked some Tron coins on the trust wallet just leave it there or better use the ledger hardware wallet they do support staking on ledger live.Hello,Thank you so much for your reply.I don't like to send my coins and tokens from Trust Wallet to another wallet because of the network fee.I don't like having multiple wallet apps.Quote from: Rigon on May 19, 2023, 04:38:45 PMQuote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PMHello,I want to migrate from the Trust Wallet to another wallet and I have some questions:1- Which wallet offers similar features and security?You can move from trust wallet to other wallet. But of course you need to import the seed phrase. But you can use Atomic Wallet and TokenPocket Wallet. You can use this wallet as multi wallet. Very good in terms of security.Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PM2- I staked some Tron coins in my Trust Wallet, if I import my seed phrase to other wallets, then What happens to them? They staked automatically to the new wallet or I must unstake them before using a new wallet?Since you have Tron staking in your trust wallet, if you use another wallet to import the same seed phrase, you must unstake your Tron from the trust.  Then you can see your Tron balance in your other account.Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PM3- Can I use two wallets simultaneously?Of course you can use  more than two wallets at the same time. But be sure to keep your wallet seed phrase in a safe place after importing it. Since you will be copying it, don't paste it on Twitter, Telegram, Messenger, etc. That should be noticed first.Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PMPlease answer my questions briefly and share your experiences.Thank you.I don't use multiple wallets. I am using trust wallet only. But I intend to use Electrum wallet very soon. Since I only hold bitcoins at the moment I decided to use Electrum wallet for more security and for my convenience.Hello,Thank you so much for your reply.Trust Wallet is good, but my problem is that I sent some Bitgert from CoinEx to my Trust Wallet and my current Trust Wallet version (5.9) doesn't support the new Bitgert network and I can't update my Trust Wallet. I use Android 7.1.1 and I don't know why the new version of Trust Wallet doesn't support my device.Hello,Please answer to this question:Which of the following wallets is better?1- TokenPocket2- Coinomi3- Guarda4- NaboxMod note: consecutive posts merged

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: You can merge all your replies into just one post and quote everyoneQuote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 06:41:03 PMHello,Thank you so much for your reply.Trust Wallet is good, but my problem is that I sent some Bitgert from CoinEx to my Trust Wallet and my current Trust Wallet version (5.9) doesn't support the new Bitgert network and I can't update my Trust Wallet. I use Android 7.1.1 and I don't know why the new version of Trust Wallet doesn't support my device.Your trust wallet is seriously old versioned because the current version of trust wallet is the 7.19.2. It also absurd that your phone isn’t compatible or support it because according to google play, the app is compatible with android phones with versions 6.0+. So you might have to look into your phone again. But if you’re looking for DApps wallet why not use MetaMask or any of the suggested wallets above.Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 06:48:54 PMHello,Please answer to this question:Which of the following wallets is better?1- TokenPocket2- Coinomi3- Guarda4- NaboxNot familiar with most of these app probably because they aren’t one of the top ones. You can read here about wallets.  https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1631151.0

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PM1- Which wallet offers similar features and security?Futures?In terms of being a multicurrency wallet, maybe unstoppable wallet could be good. In terms of security, I prefer open source to closed source wallets. Unstoppable wallet maybe? Walletscrutinity can guide you - https://walletscrutiny.com/Quote2- I staked some Tron coins in my Trust Wallet, if I import my seed phrase to other wallets, then What happens to them? They staked automatically to the new wallet or I must unstake them before using a new wallet?Nothing changes since the staking is done on the blockchain, not the wallet software.Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PM3- Can I use two wallets simultaneously?yeah, though, it exposes you more to security threats. It's like keeping 2 keys to your house in two different locations in your compound

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 06:41:03 PMTrust Wallet is good, but my problem is that I sent some Bitgert from CoinEx to my Trust Wallet and my current Trust Wallet version (5.9) doesn't support the new Bitgert network and I can't update my Trust Wallet. I use Android 7.1.1 and I don't know why the new version of Trust Wallet doesn't support my device.Does this method not work on your trustwallet?https://community.trustwallet.com/t/how-to-add-a-custom-network-on-the-trust-wallet-mobile-app/626781Just match to this entry:Network name: Bitgert MainnetNetwork URL: https://rpc.icecreamswap.comChain ID: 32520Currency symbol: BriseBlock explorer URL: https://brisescan.comhttps://www.buybitcoinbank.com/cryptocurrency/add-bitgert-chain-brise-to-metamask

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PM2- I staked some Tron coins in my Trust Wallet, if I import my seed phrase to other wallets, then What happens to them? They staked automatically to the new wallet or I must unstake them before using a new wallet?If you give us your cryptocurrency list that you prefer, the answer will be better, but I will rely that you are looking for the best Android/iOS TRON:TronWallet: it is an Open Source Secure that supports many options for you as TRON staking.Website: https://www.tronwallet.me/Gihub: https://github.com/gettyio/tronwallet-mobileIMTOKEN wallet is an easy and Secure Digital Wallet, supports bitcoin and some trading pairs, perhaps a good alternative.Website: https://token.imYou can find more TRON wallet here https://tron.netlork/wallet?lng=enIf you are looking for an alternative to trust wallet Unstoppable.money is the best, it is slow sync and you can find user experiences here https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5436273.0.Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PM3- Can I use two wallets simultaneously?Yes, but importing the same seeds between several wallets exposes you to the loss of your coin, I do not advise you to create new seed for every wallet.

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 06:48:54 PMHello,Please answer to this question:Which of the following wallets is better?1- TokenPocket2- Coinomi3- Guarda4- Nabox Trust Wallet has not been in my recommendation list since the first time I used that wallet which I almost lost all my coins there for just a transaction. The process is stressful. From the above listed wallets, I only know of coinomi though I have not used it before but most of these wallet has their root trace back to Trustwallet. So if I will answer your question, I will recommend coinomi to you. I will not recommend something that is not even popular. And by the way, coinomi is running a campaign in the forum so I advise you to use coinomi so in case you can even contact them in the forum for further information.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: Quote from: Agbe on May 20, 2023, 03:49:12 PMSo if I will answer your question, I will recommend coinomi to you. I will not recommend something that is not even popular. And by the way, coinomi is running a campaign in the forum so I advise you to use coinomi so in case you can even contact them in the forum for further information.Coinomi wallet is closed source, i will recommend only open source wallets to people because their codes can be verified, there are recommended options like Electrum that is open source, so why should one use a closed source wallet that we cannot verify what goes on behind the scenes or how the keys are generated.Coinomi wallet aren't running any active campaign on the forum, i think you are making the mistake of thinking Coinomi wallet is the same thing as Coinomize, which is a BTC mixer.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: You need to unstake your Tron to get the staked balance + staking rewards back into your original wallet. It might take a few days for that to happen. After that, your full account balance should become visible elsewhere.Why not try TronLink if you want to stake Tron? It works for Android and iOS devices.Separate your bitcoin holdings from your alt and shitcoins. In case your altcoin wallet/s get hacked, your BTC has a greater chance of not getting affected.Quote from: AbuBhakar on May 19, 2023, 04:08:44 PMAtomic wallet is your best choice if you want same feature and experience since it supports almost all coins with open source that is much better to trust wallet. Atomic Wallet is not open-source, it's closed-source. It might support open-source cryptocurrencies, but the software code isn't public. I would never use it for my bitcoin or coins I deem important to me. Since OP mentioned Tron and Tron tokens, it could be an option to store those, yes.Quote from: BitMaxz on May 19, 2023, 04:18:39 PMAnd if you staked some Tron coins on the trust wallet just leave it there or better use the ledger hardware wallet they do support staking on ledger live. Not anymore. Tron is now using a Stake 2.0 system, while Ledger only supports the old Stake 1.0 architecture. The TRX you staked via Ledger will keep collecting staking rewards, but you can't currently do anything with them through Ledger Live. You have to go through TronLink and connect that to your Ledger HW.Quote from: logfiles on May 19, 2023, 10:48:02 PMUnstoppable wallet maybe? Unstoppable Wallet offers no support for Tron and Tron-based tokens, so OP can't use it. Not for that asset at least. Quote from: Z-tight on May 20, 2023, 11:49:53 PMCoinomi wallet is closed source, i will recommend only open source wallets to people because their codes can be verified, there are recommended options like Electrum that is open source, so why should one use a closed source wallet that we cannot verify what goes on behind the scenes or how the keys are generated. OP owns altcoins like Tron. Electrum can't help him for that purpose.

comments.author: bettercrypto
comments.body: Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PMHello,I want to migrate from the Trust Wallet to another wallet and I have some questions:1- Which wallet offers similar features and security?2- I staked some Tron coins in my Trust Wallet, if I import my seed phrase to other wallets, then What happens to them? They staked automatically to the new wallet or I must unstake them before using a new wallet?3- Can I use two wallets simultaneously?Please answer my questions briefly and share your experiences.Thank you.1. There are many wallets that you can choose from and Metamask is one of them, the Klever wallet can be used because it is also under     Tron, and so on.2. Of course, since you will transfer your assets to another wallet, you must first unstake it in Truswallet, because you cannot transport it     without unstaking. Also, if you transfer your assets to another wallet, you will also need the seed phrase for import.3. Of course you can...

comments.author: yudi09
comments.body: Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PMI want to migrate from the Trust Wallet to another walletA good wish because there are many choices of wallets that are better than Trust Wallet.Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PM1- Which wallet offers similar features and security?Unstoppable wallet supports many types of coins besides Bitcoin.Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PM2- I staked some Tron coins in my Trust Wallet, if I import my seed phrase to other wallets, then What happens to them? They staked automatically to the new wallet or I must unstake them before using a new wallet?Importing the Trust Wallet seed phrase still allows them to have access as the owner of the initial seed phrase even though it is not possible for Trust Wallet to do that. Sending coins from Trust Wallet to another wallet is a good option in my opinion.Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PM3- Can I use two wallets simultaneously?Can. You can still use two wallets simultaneously.Quote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PMPlease answer my questions briefly and share your experiences.Experience using Trust Wallet?If yes, then I often experience concerns like no incoming coin notifications.

comments.author: taufik123
comments.body: Quote from: yudi09 on May 28, 2023, 12:42:31 PMQuote from: hack3rcon on May 19, 2023, 03:54:48 PMPlease answer my questions briefly and share your experiences.Experience using Trust Wallet?If yes, then I often experience concerns like no incoming coin notifications.The problem I often complain about is also while using Trust wallet. I use many wallets and probably almost all crypto wallets trying to find out which one is better and suitable for me. I currently use Safepal Mobile Wallet + Hardware Wallet, Bitkeep Wallet, and imToken. Of the three wallets, both have advantages and disadvantages, but maybe for a more complete network you can use Safepal because it is always updated with many new chains, and also for BitKeep has many features that other wallets do not have such as complete crypto security features.

comments.author: yudi09
comments.body: Quote from: taufik123 on May 31, 2023, 03:13:01 AMThe problem I often complain about is also while using Trust wallet.It would be better to stay away from this one as it is too risky.Quote from: taufik123 on May 31, 2023, 03:13:01 AMI use many wallets and probably almost all crypto wallets trying to find out which one is better and suitable for me. I currently use Safepal Mobile Wallet + Hardware Wallet, Bitkeep Wallet, and imToken. Of the three wallets, both have advantages and disadvantages, but maybe for a more complete network you can use Safepal because it is always updated with many new chains, and also for BitKeep has many features that other wallets do not have such as complete crypto security features.  I also installed many types of wallets that support android to find out the advantages and disadvantages.I used imToken for a long time but then I switched to a trust wallet before finally completely forgetting it due to several problems that occurred.For a while, the unstoppable wallet was very comfortable with me on android although there are several other types of wallets that are just as good.So far, the wallet that I use to store assets is the Electrum.
